page.title: 05OTTERTON MILL (I)
page.content: The Mill is one of the most interesting things in the village. It is run by Mrs Greenhow. Otterton Mill is on the way into Otterton. It is used to grind corn. It is on a kind of bridge across the leat( The stream comes from the river.) The water is controlled by 3 sets of sluice gates. The water wheels are made of cast iron in two halves and are undershot. The great spur and crown wheels are the four surviving wheels still fitted with wooden cogs made of apple wood. Mrs Greenhow decided to open the mill to the public because she thought it was a very interesting place.The most exciting thing was probably getting the place restored in the mid 1970s. She lives in the Mill House, just over the road from the Mill itself.
